text: [Music]
hello I'm sanghavi a cloud support
engineer here at the AWS office in
Bangalore India sometimes customers ask
me how to connect to their Linux
workspaces using SSH instead of using
the Amazon workspaces client so let me
show you how before we proceed we need
to find the workspace IP and the
associated username after logging into
the AWS management console navigate to
the Amazon workspaces console
in the navigation pane choose workspaces
choose your workspace expand the arrow
and then note the following
the workspace IP this is the private IP
address of the workspace your workspace
username
note that the private IP address is
required for getting the elastic network
interface associated with the workspace
by using the elastic network interface
you can retrieve other information such
as the security group or public IP
address associated with the workspace
next we need to add a rule for this IP
address open the Amazon ec2 console
under network and security choose
network interfaces from the navigation
in the search bar enter the workspace
private IP address that you noted
earlier click enter
you
if you're going to connect to the
workspace from outside your VPC know
deep ipv4 public address
choose the link from under the security
groups column choose the inbound tab and
choose edit
choose ad rule and then enter the
following values
sauce if you're connecting from outside
the VPC choose my AP and then enter the
IP address for every remote machine
otherwise choose custom and then enter
the private IP address of another ec2
instance in the same VPC description
enter the description for your role
to save
further we need to know the NetBIOS name
of your directory open the directory
service console
choose the directory ID for your
directory note the directory net bias
name connect to the Amazon Linux
workspace using Linux when we have all
the requirements then enter the
following command replacing the values
with the net biased name username and
the workspace IP that we noted earlier
now we have moved to the terminal let us
type the SSH command to login to the
workspace the following is an example of
the SSH command where the NetBIOS name
is the test company the username is the
test user and we will also have an
workspace IP
when prompted enter the same password
you use when authenticating with the
workspaces client that is your Active
Directory password now they have logged
into the workspaces using SSH now
connect to the Amazon Linux workspace
using putty in the putty configuration
window enter the following values for
hostname or IP address enter the
following command replace the values
with the net bias name username and
workspace IP that you noted in the
earlier steps
for put into 22 for connection type
choose SSH choose open when prompted
enter the same password you use when
authenticating with the workspaces
client that is your Active Directory
password now we have successfully logged
in using putty thanks for watching and
happy cloud computing from all of us
here at AWS
you
